title: Sanctions against Russia spark rift between US and Europe over China
subhead: Before increasing pressure on Vladimir Putin, Donald Trump is demanding his European allies stop importing Russian oil and gas and raise tariffs on Chinese goods. The EU, which will present a 19th sanctions package against Russia on Monday, finds these demands unacceptable.
byline: By Philippe Jacqué (Brussels, Europe bureau), Philippe Ricard and Harold Thibault (Beijing (China) correspondent)

title: The US-Israeli war against Gaza
subhead: The United States' fierce campaign against international justice is an implicit admission of its complicity in the crimes committed by Israel in the Gaza Strip, historian Jean-Pierre Filiu argues in his column.

title: 'Not a job, but a love story': Morocco's racing pigeon craze
subhead: Unlike Europe, where the number of breeders is declining, Moroccans are embracing pigeon racing with enthusiasm. In Casablanca, more than 1,000 fanciers are concerned about rising temperatures that threaten their birds.

title: Putin's party prevails in Russian elections even without campaigning
subhead: Local elections were held across Russia on September 12 and 14. The campaign was particularly dull in Kostroma, a tourist town northeast of Moscow, revealing a society stifled by repression and overcome by apathy and weariness.

The thorny issue of splitting expenses in a relationship: 'Going 50/50 is a scam'
subhead: When moving in together, the question of 'who pays for what?' is often avoided. To break this taboo, social media content encourages couples to manage their finances more fairly, particularly to ensure that women are less disadvantaged.

title: Charlie Kirk assassination: The suspect's disconcerting profile
subhead: Tyler Robinson, arrested on Thursday night, is a 22-year-old White man who grew up in a conservative family in Utah and was a brilliant high school student. Nothing in his background supports the theory being propagated in MAGA circles that he is a far-left activist.
byline: By Arnaud Leparmentier (Saint George, (Utah) special correspondent)

title: Undercover but never unmasked: The untold story of a KGB spy in France
subhead: Following archival research and interviews with witnesses, Le Monde pieced together the completely unknown story of 'Lydia Tows,' a Russian agent who died in Paris in 1999. Working in tandem with a French police officer, she carried out a decades-long infiltration mission with devastating consequences.
